info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 10:08PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WITH EMBEDDED SNOW SQUALLS WILL AFFECT PORTIONS OF SCHENECTADY...SOUTHERN SARATOGA...ALBANY...RENSSELAER...SCHOHARIE... COLUMBIA...GREENE AND ULSTER COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of snow showers with embedded snow squalls accompanied by winds of up to 45 MPH, which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. Precipitation will begin as rain in lower elevations before quickly changing to snow. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1003 PM EDT, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from near Amsterdam to Jeffersonville and moving east at 40 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Duanesburg, Delanson and Pattersonville-Rotterdam Junction around 1015 PM EDT. Rotterdam Junction around 1020 PM EDT. Rotterdam, Scotia, Altamont and East Glenville around 1025 PM EDT. Schenectady, Niskayuna and Alplaus around 1030 PM EDT. Clifton Park, Colonie and Guilderland around 1035 PM EDT. Albany around 1040 PM EDT. Troy, Cohoes, Watervliet, Rensselaer, Ellenville, Latham, Delmar, Menands, Green Island and Waterford around 1045 PM EDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 22 and 25. Interstate 90 between exits 10 and 27. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 9. Interstate 87 between exits 19 and 7, and between exits 8A and 9. Interstate 787 between exits 1 and 9. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
